body.name: ASUS TUF Gaming Z790-Plus WiFi LGA 1700(Intel 14th,12th &13th Gen) ATX Gaming Motherboard(PCIe 5.0,DDR5,4xM.2 Slots,16+1 DrMOS,WiFi 6,2.5Gb LAN,Front USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C,Thunderbolt 4(USB4),Aura RGB)
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 3 hrs 9 mins
features: Intel LGA 1700 socket: Ready for 12thand13th Gen Intel Core processors, support PCIe 5.0,DDR5 and out of box Windows 11 ready
Enhanced Power Solution: 16plus1 DrMOS, ProCool sockets, military-grade TUF components, and Digiplus VRM for maximum durability and performance
Comprehensive Cooling : VRM heatsink, PCH fanless heatsink, M.2 heatsink, hybrid fan headers and Fan Xpert 4 utility
Ultra-Fast Gaming Networking : WiFi 6 AX201 (802.11 ax), Intel I225-V 2.5Gb LAN, TUF LANGuard and TurboLAN technology
Fastest Connectivity: 4x M.2/NVMe SSD, Front panel USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C header, USB Gen 2x2 Type-C and Thunderbolt 4 (USB4)header
PC DIY Friendly: SafeDIMM, PCIe 5.0 Safeslot, Q-LED, M.2 Q-Latch, Pre-mount I/O shield
New TUF Gaming Aesthetics: New ID design, Synchronizable LED effects across a vast portfolio of compatible PC gear, including addressable RGB strips with Aura Sync

Immersive Gaming Audio and AI Noise Cancellation: The Realtek S1200A codec offers pristine audio quality to draw you deeper into the game action or to enhance your favorite music tracks or videos.Communicate clearly with ASUS AI Noise Canceling Mic technology
body.description: ASUS TUF GAMING Z790-PLUS WiFi takes all the essential elements of the latest 14th,13th Gen Intel Core processors and combines them with game-ready features and proven durability. Engineered with military-grade components, an upgraded power solution and a comprehensive cooling system, this motherboard offers rock-solid, stable performance for marathon gaming. Aesthetically, TUF GAMING Z790-PLUS WiFi sports the new TUF Gaming logo, and incorporates simple geometric design elements to reflect the dependability and stability that defines the TUF Gaming series.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 1,240 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: ASUS is one of Fortune magazine’s World’s Most Admired Companies and is one of the top motherboard and gaming brands, as well as a top-three consumer notebook vendor. ASUS is driven by passion and innovation and dedicated to creating quality products for a future smart life, designing and manufacturing products that perfectly meet the needs of today's digital home, office and person. Our wide portfolio includes MG248Q, Chromebox and a range of devices and components, along with AR and VR. TUF GAMING Z790-PLUS WIFI TUF GAMING Z790-PLUS WIFI takes all the essential elements of the latest Intel processors and combines them with game-ready features and proven durability. Engineered with military-grade components, an upgraded power solution and a comprehensive cooling system, this motherboard goes beyond expectations with rock-solid performance for marathon gaming. Intel LGA 1700 socket: Ready for 13th Gen Intel Core processors Enhanced power solution: 16+1 DrMOS, six-layer PCB, ProCool sockets, alloy chokes and durable capacitors for stable power delivery Next-gen connectivity: PCIe 5.0, USB 3.2 Gen2x2 Type-C, front USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C, Thunderbolt 4 header support Made for online gaming: WiFi 6E, Intel 2.5 Gb Ethernet and TUF LANGuard Two-Way AI Noise Cancelation: Reduces background noise for crystal-clear communication in games or video conferences AI Cooling II: Balances thermals and acoustics of any build with a single click Comprehensive cooling: Enlarged VRM and PCH heatsinks, M.2 heatsinks, hybrid fan headers and Fan Xpert 4 utility in Armoury Crate Aura Sync RGB effects: Stylish edge lighting design, addressable RGB headers and RGB strip header support

DrMOS Power Stages 16+1 power stages are each rated to handle 60 amperes, combining high-side and low-side MOSFETS and drivers into a single package to deliver power, efficiency and stable performance for all compatible Intel processors. Six-Layer PCB Design The multi-layered printed circuit board design quickly dissipates heat around the voltage regulators to improve overall system stability and provide the CPU with more overclocking headroom. DRAM Overclocking Performance Unleash DDR5 With AEMP II ASUS Enhanced Memory Profile II is an exclusive firmware feature for PMIC-restricted memory modules. AEMP II is based on a CPU and memory module’s ability to train the memory chips on your kit, and it presents an optimized clock speed that can effortlessly unleash performance. Built through a flexible training method, AEMP II makes it easy to not only tune the memory above baseline settings but also maintain the stability of system operation, whether getting the most out of an entry-level module or priming a high-speed kit for ultimate performance.

PCIe 4.0 Support The four PCIe 4.0 M.2 slots support up to two 22110 devices and also provide NVMe SSD RAID support for incredible performance potential. Create a RAID configuration with up to four PCIe 4.0 storage devices to enjoy the fastest data transfer speeds. Cooler By Design The TUF GAMING Z790-PLUS WIFI is armed with an enlarged VRM heatsink, while three M.2 slots and the PCH feature heatsinks that provide the perfect balance of mass and surface area for heat dissipation. Connectivity The TUF-GAMING Z790-PLUS WIFI reaches new heights of performance potential with the latest version of PCI Express, while an arsenal of USB ports includes three Type-C connections, and the Thunderbolt 4 expands compatibility and bandwidth even further. 1. USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 Type-C 2. PCIe 5.0 3. Thunderbolt(USB4) Support 4. Front USB3.2 Gen 2 Type-C

WiFi 6 Onboard WiFi 6E technology takes advantage of the newly available radio spectrum in the 6 GHz band. It delivers ultrafast wireless networking speeds and improved capacity, as well as better performance in dense wireless environments.* SafeSlot & SafeDIMM SafeSlot is a reinforced metal sheath added to a PCIe slot to keep a card firmly installed. Because PCIe 5.0 is two times faster than PCIe 4.0, ASUS enhanced SMT manufacturing processes for the faster SafeSlot―all to ensure users get the highest-possible data speeds. In addition, the ASUS SafeDIMM sheath is added to support and protect memory modules on select ASUS motherboards, empowering you to insert modules with speed, accuracy and confidence. PCIe Q-Release A physical button unlocks the first PCIe slot’s security latch with one tap, greatly simplifying the process of detaching a PCIe card from the motherboard when it’s time to upgrade to a new GPU or other compatible device.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great bang for the buck!
reviews.reviewText: 4.5 - I can't complain, this install was easy, yet there is one hiccup. No LAN or WIFI found during Windows 11 Pro fresh install. Solution: When at the screen shift+F10, type in the command prompt OOBE\BYPASSNRO and hit enter. I have read some install the drivers prior to this step, but I found this was easier. Windows 11 will continue on its own.There are plenty of RAM choices to match with the board and Asus support page is excellent for finding a CPU and RAM for this board.Make sure you install the Asus Armoury crate as well, there were quite a few updates that will clear up your Device Manager.I haven't tried overclocking the CPU yet, but the XMP1 profile is working fine and I haven't had any crashes running any games.Disclosure: This review, in part, is for the extended 90 day warranty available through Asus.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Motherboard...after you get Windows installed
reviews.reviewText: I struggled for quite some time to get Windows 11 installed from scratch with this motherboard. I kept having problems getting a LAN connection and the mouse wouldn't work. After hours of frustration where Windows could not get an internet connection to install, I tried Alt-Tab and found another window open in the background in addition to the Windows installer. It was a pop up box asking if I wanted to install the ArmorCrate software. I clicked yes and like magic the mouse and LAN were recognized and the install finally continued. Other than that hiccup, the board works great and I have a full 128 GB of DDR5 ram with an Intel Core i9 processor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great besides from a small inconvenience at set up
reviews.reviewText: Once it’s all set up it works well with no issues. Supports fast ddr5 ram speeds and 12-14th gen intel cpus and windows 11 out of the box. Only thing I didn’t like was having to install WiFi drivers when setting it up, so just have the correct drivers on a usb ready or somethingCheck to see if all drivers and bios is up to date also

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a beautiful board the only problem I have with it is I don't have enough USB ports other than that it's great

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Wait to buy until they work out the kinks!
reviews.reviewText: Asus was once a brand I loved and trusted, both their tech and their customer support. That is sadly no longer the case, I had left Asus a few years ago over similar problems as these and though it was time I gave them a second chance. The motherboard looked as good as all had made it seem and the first setup was going great all save one thing, the new DDR5 memory was running 800MHz lower than it should have. There was much to this new BIOS that had been put under new headings, terms and a large amount of new things for the new chipset so I was unfamiliar with it. I shrugged it off and figured I would sort it out after Windows was installed and all the drivers. There was to be no solution and several other things that should have appeared for the chip I had bought did not. I am extremely disabled and apon calling Asus I found myself confronted with one confounded employee after another. I was told that I would then get a call back from the higher tech team that could help me in an hour or so and I wouldn't be sent the motherboard questionnaire because of my disabilities and hours on the phone, the tech team would have called me back even if I had not managed to finish is I was told. I then proceeded to wait expectantly for the next 3 hours, the remaining time of their open hours that day and no call came. I was out of commission dew to my body for the next 24 hours and once I was able I check my email not expecting anything from Asus and there sits an email from some guy and to this point Iail had only delt with women. The email said that I needed to fill out this form and send it back so that the higher tech team could recreate my problem in the lab, the attached form was for a WIFI card!!! Called the next day asking to speak to a supervisor, I was flatly told no, I repeated saying why this time, again but rudely this time NO! I was then forced over the coarse of the next hour to work the entire motherboard problem with him! He stopped, blaming the entire problem on me having checked my memories part number and it not being on their compatible list! Two other before him had checked and they said that it was correct I questioned him. I asked for further assistance but he was done helping me and wanted to end the call, I said that I still need to speak with a supervisor, once again but nastily this time he hissed NO! Two more times I plied him that it was only about what happen with my previous calls and he kept insisting that I didn't need a Supervisor because they would just tell me the same thing he did about the motherboard. Finally I said look it's not about you ok, I am not going to get you in trouble. (It most certainly now was and I most certainly was going to!) He relented saying "let me see if one is available" I thanked him. He came back saying he had a supervisor and he would connect me, I sighed in relief. I relayed everything that had happened to me in everything, the pleasant supervisor promised that everything would be looked into and delt with and that I would never have such a thing happen again. After making sure that I was ordering the right memory for same day delivery and noting the account we ended the call. The new memory came a couple hours later and I put it in then booted it up. Once into the BIOS it to was running at 4000MHz which was wrong, I worked the problem as one who has been building computers for 30 years would and found that not only did it start of the same it in fact was much worse than the other memory! I called Asus back getting a nice sounding lady, I asked for a supervisor and she ask me why? I replied that my case required one where things left off last and that I want to pick back up with one again. She said, ok no problem can I have you name and case number to give to them, I said sure and she put me on hold, I thought to myself "well that was nice for a change. A few minutes went by as I began to think this is taking a long time to get a supervisor just as she came back on the line. All politeness now gone from her voice, now decidedly negative and discourteous she barked at me "After reviewing your case you don't need a supervisor! You need to send us the motherboard if it's still not working on an RMA.....". I had never said the exact reason for my call only that I needed a supervisor and it was related to my case. I would tolerate the abuse from ASUS NO MORE and hung up, I had the motherboard for 5 days and it was clear that it was bad out of the box so I returned it and in formed Amazon of the whole sorry affair. IN FINAL REVEIW IT'S SAD THAT IT WASN'T JUST THE MOTHERBOARD THAT WAS BAD BUT IN MY OPION ALL OF ASUS HAS GONE BAD! BUYER BE WARE!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great board, bad Intel network support
reviews.reviewText: ASUS did a great overall build with this board.Issues: NIC and RAM---This is an overall great board, with the notable exception of the 2.5 gig Intel i225/i226 network chipset, which a lot of manufacturers are putting in Intel-CPU (especially Z790) boards. The i225/i226 chipset DOESN'T PLAY NICE with any Verizon hardware. Something to do with IPv6 support; Verizon's routers won't see the NIC, and the NIC won't register any connection. A simple $20 Realtek PCIe or even USB network card solves the problem immediately, but you need to know that going in.My only other complaint is the one-sided memory DIMM clasps. I find that it's much harder to install RAM when one side of the mounting slot is rigid/fixed, instead of having folding tabs on both sides.Features: Everything else on this board was solid out-of-the-box!---During the bios boot process, the mobo persists a VGA signal so that the monitor STAYS ON during a reboot. This is such a nice feature because it lets me know it hasn't hung! When performing a long reboot, e.g. to enable XMP or change some overclock settings, the logo sticks around so the user knows the system's still "doing something". Nice.Speaking of XMP, I was able to get a full 128 gb of DDR5 RAM working at the advertised 4800 MHz clock speeds with no issues. The CPU is also clocked correctly, and the power scaling of the processor itself, and the system as a whole, is very smooth. System sleeps and wakes with no issues, and low-power states don't seem to mess with other "nice-to-haves" like LEDs or other peripherals.Plenty of options for LEDs, not as much for SATA drives. The M2 mounting points are robust and the heat spreaders seem like they're nice hefty aluminum to dissipate the heat.Takeaway:All in all, this board was NOT A HEADACHE to get running at full capacity, and that's more than I can say for most motherboards I've installed in the last decade. Do recommend.
Llego rápido en 3 días, la caja venía muy cuidada y todo funciono al 100.

I've been a fan of Asus for many years. The price of this thing shocked me, but I needed the performance, so I accepted that this is the going rate for such things. I was pleasantly surprised; this is a meticulously engineered product, and in every way I got the sense that they put effort into delivering a quality product.The price is still painful, but I can't say I feel ripped off; it's a fine piece of technology.

I installed this about 3 weeks ago and it was pretty smooth sailing. There are lots of plastic film covers on various parts to keep it from scratching during install/shipping. Remember to peel them off as you are installing.It has some LED lights that can be turned on or off in the BIOS. Speaking of BIOS, Asus motherboards always have nice, clear and easy to use BIOS software. This one is no different.One feature that I likes (but also hated) was that the screws in the M.2 SSD heatsinks were attached to the heatsink. It makes it easier for those with bigger hands to get the screw in place. In the other hand, it also made it difficult to line the screw up with the hole. I feel like there could be a happy medium there.Finding the Windows drivers was pretty simple, but on first boot, you are prompted to install the Asus Armoury Crate software. It let's you control/view the fan speeds, LED lights, see the temperatures, install latest drivers and more. It's actually a really slick idea, but the software itself is awful. It takes up a lot of memory and it crashes all the time. I suggest installing it to get the fastest drivers, then uninstall it right away. NOTE: You will need to use Asus' Armoury Crate Uninstaller tool available on their website to completely rid yourself of it.So far, I haven't had any issues with the motherboard itself. Hopefully it stays that way for a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Price was slightly higher then i normally pay but so worth it
reviews.reviewText: Honestly, i was not looking for the best motherboard out there but this one did seem to tick off a lot of box's i was trying to get in my next build. (First in 10 years for personal)- Intel CPU socket, Wifi, Bluetooth, overclocking, high speed DDR5, 2X or more M.2 slots, (this has 4) more then 3 system fans and then CPU fan, [4 pins] (this has 1 CPU 1CPU alt 1 AIO and 4 System and all are 4 pin connections) it also has 4+ sata connections (for old hard drives and data ->sadly, only has 4X) and ARGB connectivity. (This has 3 ARGB Aura Sync connectors for easy cable managment)CPU i bough i knew was not going to have integrated graphics so the on board graphics ports would not be used in my case but good to know this option is offered on this board.I do no like the top PCIe16X slot placements. Top one makes it so if i wanted to add a 3 fan addon to the rear of my GPU to pull head up and away from the PCB board then it wont fit (or at least with the one i had purchased) and the bottom one is too close to my battery box so IF i say wanted dual GPU's that were 2 slot cards, then the bottom one cannot fit with the case i picked (tested with my Asus TUF 3060 just to see) sure, another case option may differ for you.All in all this board is great though, my choice in tower is more of an issue then anything at all on this board. I slapped it together in about an hour and it just worked. the motherboard takes about 10 seconds to boot bios and show the TUF logo for the first time and it kinda made me question myself for a second (I have not changed it yet but i think there's a fast boot option) (*UPDATE: Not that i could find)My RAM, CPU, Motherboard, and M.2 NVMe SSD combo works extremely well and would highly recommend, after TUF logo goes away windows login screen comes up in 3-4 seconds then after i type my passcode and press login, my 15 startup programs i use load only another 8 seconds have passed XD i have 0 complaints.wish i knew how tall my M.2 heat sink was on my Fire Cuda 530 1TB before i bought it because i could not put the shield back on after i installed it so for those i recommend NVMe SSDs not have heat syncs else they may not fit.The ARGB on the board itself is very suddel and with a lot of other ARGB things in a case you cannot even notice it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buen desempeño, estetica y materiales de menor calidad
reviews.reviewText: Siempre he confiado en la marca ASUS y en la series TUF, pero esta ocacion he notado reduccion en la calidad esteticamente y de conectores (los materiales electricos vienen certificados y espero sean de calidad)Tuve problemas al remover la primera vez el conector USB, tengo experiencia en ensamble, asi que en ningun momento se vio forzado el conector. Como pueden ver en la imagen no hay refuerzo en la mother para el conector.Tambien note que las cubiertas para el backblate, chipset y VRM son de plastico de mala calidad, y ni siquiera el branding de TUF esta embebido, son estampas.Solo recomiendo este producto si no busca añadidos esteticos comparado con la series ROG, incluso PRIME luce mejor ahora.
